src: Poskrbite, da bo vaša roka kar se da sproščena, vendar da hkrati še vedno pravilno udarite vse note – poleg tega se poskusite izogniti nepotrebnim gibom s prsti. Tako se boste najmanj utrudili. Ne pozabite, da z močnejšim pritiskanjem tipk ne boste dosegli tudi večje glasnosti, kot na primer pri klavirju. Za večjo glasnost harmonike je treba povečati pritisk na meh ali hitrost.
mt: 1. Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible, but still hitting the keys correctly. Try to avoid unnecessary finger movements. This will help you not to tire. Don't forget that pressing the keys harder will not make the harmonica louder, as on a piano. To increase the volume of a harmonica, you have to increase the pressure on the reed or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Med najpogostejšimi težavami pri pretvarjanju filma v format DVD so obrezani robovi slike. Večina televizorjev je narejenih tako, da zadovoljijo potrebe širše javnosti. Zaradi tega je vse na televizijskem ekranu prikazano z obrezanimi robovi zgoraj, spodaj in ob straneh. To storijo zato, da slika prekrije celoten zaslon. To je slika z odrezanimi robovi. Žal bodo pri izdelavi DVD-ja najverjetneje odrezani tudi robovi, in če so podnapisi videoposnetka preblizu spodnjemu robu, se ne bodo videli v celoti.
mt: One of the most common problems in converting film to DVD format is cropped edges of the image. Most televisions are designed to meet the needs of the general public. Therefore, everything on the television screen is shown with cropped edges at the top, bottom, and sides. This is a picture with cropped edges. Unfortunately, the edges will most likely be cropped when making a DVD, and if the subtitles of the video are too close to the bottom edge, they will not be seen completely.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Ameriški načrt je temeljil na izvajanju usklajenih napadov iz treh različnih smeri. General John Cadwalder je sprožil diverzijski napad na britansko garnizijo v Bordentownu, da bi blokiral morebitne okrepitve. General James Ewing je s 700 pripadniki milice prečkal reko v bližini Trenton Ferryja, zasedel most čez reko Assunpink Creek in tako vsem sovražnikovim enotam preprečil pobeg. Glavna udarna sila, sestavljena iz 2400 mož, je reko prečkala devet milj severno od Trentona, nato pa se razdelila na dve skupini, eno pod vodstvom Greena in drugo pod vodstvom Sullivana, da bi napadla pred zoro.
mt: The American plan was based on coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder launched a diversionary attack on the British garrison in Bordentown to block any reinforcements. General James Ewing crossed the river with 700 militia near Trenton Ferry, seized the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and thus prevented any retreat of the enemy forces. The main striking force, consisting of 2400 men, crossed the river nine miles north of Trenton, then split into two groups, one under the command of Green and the other under the command of Sullivan, to attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "Potem ko ga je 4. julija kongres sprejel, so ročno napisan osnutek, ki sta ga podpisala predsednik kongresa John Hancock in sekretar Charles Thomson, poslali nekaj ulic stran v tiskarno Johna Dunlapa. Ponoči so izdelali med 150 in 200 izvodov, znanih kot ""Dunlapovi letaki"". Dokument je prvič javno prebral John Nixon 8. julija na dvorišču Independence Hall. Enega so 6. julija poslali Georgu Washingtonu, ki ga je 9. julija dal prebrati svojim četam v New Yorku. En izvod je dosegel London 10. avgusta. Še vedno obstaja 25 Dunlapovih letakov, ki veljajo za najstarejše ohranjene kopije tega dokumenta, saj se ročno napisani izvirnik ni ohranil."
mt: "After it was approved by the Congress on July 4, the handwritten draft, signed by Congress President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson, was sent a few blocks away to the printing house of John Dunlap. That night, they produced between 150 and 200 copies, known as the "Dunlap broadsides". The document was first publicly read by John Nixon on July 8 on the grounds of Independence Hall. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. There are still 25 Dunlap broadsides, the oldest surviving copies of this document, as the original handwritten draft has not been preserved."
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Ko so kolonisti videli to dogajanje, so prav tako poklicali okrepitve. Čete, ki so podpirale sprednje pozicije, so vključevale 1. in 3. newhampshirski polk 200 mož, ki sta jih vodila polkovnika John Stark in James Reed (oba sta kasneje postala generala). Starkovi možje so se razporedili ob ograji severno od položaja kolonistov. Ko se je ob oseki odprl prostor ob reki Mystic ob severovzhodnem robu polotoka, so hitro dogradili nizek kamnit zid vse do severnega konca pri robu vode na majhni plaži. Gridley oziroma Stark je približno 100 čevljev (30 m) pred ograjo postavil količek in ukazal, da nihče ne sme streljati, dokler mimo njega ne pridejo redni vojaki.
mt: When the colonists saw this happening, they also called for reinforcements. The troops supporting the front positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men each, led by colonels John Stark and James Reed (both of whom later became generals). Stark's men were deployed along the fence to the north of the colonists' position. When the opening at the bend of the river Mystic at the northeast corner of the peninsula was cleared, they quickly built a low stone wall all the way to the northern end at the edge of the water on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a cairn about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one shoot until regular soldiers came through it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Starodavna Kitajska je različna časovna obdobja prikazovala na poseben način; vsaka stopnja Kitajske ali vsaka družina, ki je bila na oblasti, je bila prepoznavna dinastija. Med posameznimi dinastijami je nastopilo tudi nestabilno obdobje, ko so bile province razdeljene. Med temi obdobji je najbolj znano obdobje treh kraljestev v času med dinastijama Han in Jin, ki je trajalo 60 let. V teh obdobjih so se odvijali siloviti boji med mnogimi plemiči, ki so bili bitko za prestol. Obdobje treh kraljestev je bilo eno od najbolj krvavih obdobij v zgodovini starodavne Kitajske, saj je v boju za najvišji stolček v veliki palači mesta Šjan umrlo na tisoče ljudi.
mt: Ancient China was different time periods shown in a special way; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a recognizable dynasty. Between the dynasties there was also an unstable period, when the provinces were divided. Among these periods is best known period of the Three Kingdoms in the time between the Han and Jin dynasties, which lasted 60 years. In these periods were held fierce battles between many nobles, who were fighting for the throne. The period of the Three Kingdoms was one of the most bloody periods in the history of ancient China, as in the fight for the highest seat in the great palace of the city of Shyan died thousands of people.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Kolonije bojnih mravelj prav tako hodijo in gnezdijo v različnih fazah. Ko so bojne mravlje v nomadski fazi, se premikajo ponoči, podnevi pa se ustavijo in počivajo. Kolonija preide v nomadsko fazo, ko se zmanjšajo zaloge hrane. V tej fazi kolonija zgradi začasna mravljišča, ki jih vsakodnevno spreminjajo. Vsako takšno nomadsko razsajanje oziroma pohod traja okoli 17 dni.
mt: Ant colonies also march and nest in different phases. When ants are in the nomadic phase, they move at night, and rest during the day. The colony goes into the nomadic phase when food supplies are dwindling. In this phase, the colony builds temporary nests, which it changes daily. Each such nomadic foray or march lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Večina opazovanih ritmov v psihologiji in vedenju je pogosto bistveno odvisnih od prisotnosti endogenih ciklov ter njihovega nastanka s pomočjo bioloških ur. Ponavljajoče se ritme, ki niso le odzivi na periodične zunanje dražljaje, so zabeležili pri večini živih bitij, vključno z bakterijami, glivami, rastlinami in živalmi. Biološke ure so samovzdržni oscilatorji, ki obdobja neprekinjenih cikličnih ponovitev nadaljujejo tudi ob odsotnosti zunanjih dražljajev.
mt: Most observed rhythms in psychology and behavior are often crucially dependent on the presence of endogenous cycles and their creation with the help of biological clocks. Repeating rhythms that are not just responses to periodic external stimuli have been observed in most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that continue cycles of uninterrupted repetition even in the absence of external stimuli.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Populacija je skupina organizmov določene vrste znotraj določenega geografskega območja. Ko je določena fenotipska značilnost popolnoma enaka pri vseh posameznikih v populaciji, so ti posamezniki monomorfni. Ko posamezniki kažejo več variant določene značilnosti, so polimorfni.
mt: A population is a group of organisms of the same species living in the same area. When a particular phenotypic trait is completely uniform among all individuals in a population, they are monomorphic. When individuals exhibit multiple variants of a particular trait, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Naravni turizem privablja ljudi, ki jih zanima obisk naravnih območij, da bi se naužili lepot pokrajine, vključno z rastlinami in divjimi živalmi. Terenske dejavnosti so med drugim tudi lov, ribolov, fotografija, opazovanje ptic in obiskovanje parkov ter preučevanje informacij o ekosistemu. Tak primer je ogled, fotografiranje in spoznavanje orangutanov v Borneu.
mt: Natural tourism attracts people who are interested in visiting natural areas to learn about the beauty of the landscape, including plants and wildlife. Field activities include hunting, fishing, photography, birdwatching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is viewing, photographing, and learning about orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Ljudje vsako jutro v avtomobilih zapuščajo svoja majhna podeželska mesta, da bi prišli na delovno mesto, mimo njih pa se vozijo tisti, ki delajo v kraju, od koder so ravnokar odšli. V tem dinamičnem prevoznem sredstvu so vsi nekako povezani s transportnim sistemom na podlagi osebnih avtomobilov in ga tudi podpirajo. Znanost zdaj kaže, da je masivno ogljično gospodarstvo biosfero izrinilo iz enega od njenih stabilnih stanj, ki so v zadnjih dveh milijonih let podpirali evolucijo človeka.
mt: People every morning in their cars leave their small rural towns to go to work, passing by those who work in the place they just left. In this dynamic transportation system, everyone is somehow connected to the transportation system based on personal automobiles and supports it. Science now shows that massive carbon economy has kicked the biosphere out of one of its stable states that have supported human evolution in the last two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atom lahko štejemo kot enega temeljnih gradnikov vseh snovi. Gre za kompleksno entiteto, ki je glede na poenostavljeni Bohrov model sestavljena iz osrednjega jedra, okrog katerega krožijo elektroni, podobno kot planeti okrog sonca – glejte Sliko 1.1. Jedro sestavljata dva delca – nevtroni in protoni. Protoni imajo pozitivni električni naboj, nevtroni pa so brez naboja. Elektroni imajo negativni električni naboj.
mt: 1.1.1. The atom can be counted as one of the basic building blocks of all substances. It is a complex entity, which according to the simplified Bohr model is composed of a central nucleus around which electrons revolve, similar to planets around the sun – see Figure 1.1. The nucleus is composed of two particles – neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Tako rekoč vsi računalniki, ki jih danes uporabljamo, so osnovani na manipulaciji informacij, ki so kodirane v obliki binarnih številk. Dvojiško število ima lahko samo eno od dveh vrednosti, t. j. 0 ali 1, ti dve številki se imenujeta dvojiški števki – ali bita, če uporabimo računalniški žargon.
mt: In practice, all computers we use today are based on manipulating information encoded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, these two numbers are called binary digits or bits, if we use computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Tako rekoč vsi računalniki, ki jih danes uporabljamo, so osnovani na manipulaciji informacij, ki so kodirane v obliki binarnih številk. Dvojiško število ima lahko samo eno od dveh vrednosti, t. j. 0 ali 1, ti dve številki se imenujeta dvojiški števki – ali bita, če uporabimo računalniški žargon.
mt: In practice, all computers we use today are based on manipulating information encoded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, these two numbers are called binary digits or bits, if we use computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Spletni dnevniki lahko učencem pomagajo izboljšati svoj slog pisanja. Čeprav večina učencev začne pisati spletni dnevnik s površno slovnico in črkovanjem, se to s prisotnostjo občinstva navadno spremeni. Ker so lahko učenci pogosto najbolj zahtevna publika, se pisec bloga začne truditi izboljšati pisanje, da bi se izognil kritiki. Poleg tega pisanje spletnih dnevnikov ""učence prisili v to, da bolje se bolje zavedajo sveta okoli njih."" Potreba po tem, da bi pritegnili zanimanje publike, učence navdihuje, da želijo biti pametni in zanimivi (Toto, 2004). Vodenje spletnega dnevnika je orodje, ki spodbuja sodelovanje in prizadevanje učencev, da se učijo, tudi kadar niso v šoli. Ustrezna uporaba spletnih dnevnikov ""lahko spodbudi študente k bolj analitičnemu in kritičnemu razmišljanju; s stalnim odzivanjem na spletni material lahko študenti določijo svoj položaj glede na zapise drugih in izoblikujejo svoj pogled na določene teme (Oravec, 2002)."
mt: "Online journals can help students improve their writing style. Although most students begin writing an online journal with a superficial grammar and spelling, this usually changes with the presence of an audience. Because students are often the most demanding audience, the blog writer will begin to try to improve his writing to avoid criticism. In addition, writing online journals ""forces students to better understand their world."" The need to attract an audience inspires students to want to be smart and interesting (Toto, 2004). Running an online journal is a tool that encourages students to collaborate and strive to learn, even when they are not in school. Appropriate use of online journals ""can encourage students to be more analytical and critical; by constantly responding to online material, students can determine their position in relation to the writings of others and shape their view on certain topics (Oravec, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Asinhrona komunikacija omogoča čas za razmislek in odzivanje na druge ljudi. Učencem omogoča, da delajo v svojem tempu in nadzirajo hitrost učenja izobraževalnih vsebin. Poleg tega je zaradi mogočega prilagodljivega delovnega časa manj časovnih omejitev. (Bremer, 1998) Učenci lahko do informacij nenehno dostopajo z uporabo interneta in svetovnega spleta. Učenci lahko učiteljem zastavljajo vprašanja tekom celega dne in pričakujejo razmeroma hitre odgovore, tako da jim ni treba čakati na naslednje srečanje iz oči v oči.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows time for reflection and response to others. Students are able to work at their own pace and monitor the speed of learning instructional content. In addition, there are fewer time constraints due to the flexible work schedule. (Bremer, 1998) Students can access information continuously using the Internet and the World Wide Web. Students can pose questions to teachers throughout the day and expect relatively quick responses, so they do not have to wait for the next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Tradicionalni srednjeveški grad že dolga leta buri domišljijo s prizori dvobojev s kopji, pojedin in arturijanskega kavalirstva. Celo ko stojimo sredi tisoč let starih ruševin, si lahko enostavno predstavljamo zvoke in vonjave davno minulih bitk, skorajda slišimo klopot kopit na tlakovcih ter zavohamo strah, ki se dviga iz temnic. Vendar, ali naša domišljija temelji na resničnosti? Zakaj so bili gradovi sploh zgrajeni? Kako so jih načrtovali in zgradili?
mt: The traditional medieval castle has long been stirring the imagination with scenes of jousting, tournaments and Arthurian chivalry. Even as we stand amidst the ruins of a thousand years, we can easily imagine the sounds and smells of long past battles, almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and catch the scent of fear rising from the dungeons. But, does our imagination rest on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Grad Kirby Muxloe je, kot je značilno za obdobje, bolj utrjena zgradba, kot zaresen grad. Njegova velika steklena okna in tanki zidovi ne bi prenesli dolgega in nepopustljivega napada. V 80. letih 15. stoletja, ko je Lord Hastings pričel njegovo gradnjo, je bila država razmeroma mirna in so se morali braniti le pred manjšimi napadi potujočih razbojnikov.
mt: Kirby Muxloe Castle is, as is typical of the period, a more substantial building than a true castle. Its large glass windows and thin walls would not have withstood a long and relentless assault. In the 1480s, when Lord Hastings began its construction, the country was relatively peaceful and they had to defend only against small raids by traveling outlaws.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Ko iz teka na četrt milje prestopiš na tek na pol milje, postane hitrost precej manj pomembna, vzdržljivost pa brezpogojno obvezna. Vrhunski tekač na pol milje, človek, ki lahko razdaljo premaga prej kot v dveh minutah, mora seveda biti zelo hiter, vendar pa mora za vsako ceno skrbeti za vzdržljivost. Najboljša priprava za tekaško sezono je kros čez zimo v kombinaciji z vajami za zgornji del telesa.
mt: When you transition from a quarter-mile run to a half-mile run, speed becomes much less important, and endurance becomes absolutely mandatory. The best quarter-mile runner, the man who can cover the distance before two minutes, must be very fast, but he must also be willing to pay the price for endurance. The best preparation for a running season is cross training in the winter combined with upper-body workouts.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Samo dobre prehrambne navade ne morejo ustvariti izjemnih rezultatov, lahko pa močno vplivajo na splošno dobro počutje mladih športnikov. Ohranjanje zdravega energetskega ravnovesja, ohranjanje učinkovitih hidracijskih navad in razumevanje različnih vidikov uporabe dopolnil lahko športnikom pomaga izboljšati zmogljivost ter povečati užitek v športu.
mt: Only good dietary habits cannot create exceptional results, but they can have a strong impact on the overall well-being of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, maintaining effective hydration habits and understanding the different aspects of the use of supplements can help athletes improve their performance and increase the enjoyment of sport.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Tek na srednje proge je relativno poceni šport; vendar pa obstaja veliko napačnih predstav, ki se tičejo nekaterih delov opreme, potrebne za sodelovanje. Izdelke se lahko kupi po potrebi, ampak večina bo imela malo ali skoraj nič vpliva na rezultat. Športnikom je lahko nek izdelek ljubši, tudi če nima dejanskih prednosti.
mt: The middle-distance race is a relatively cheap sport; however, there are many misconceptions about some of the equipment needed to compete. Items can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no impact on the result. Some athletes may prefer one item over another, even if it has no real advantages.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: MRI temelji na fizikalnem pojavu, imenovanem jedrska magnetna resonanca (NMR), ki sta ga v 30. letih 20. stoletja odkrila Felix Bloch (zaposlen na Univerzi Stanford) in Edward Purcell (z Univerze Harvard). V tej resonanci atomi zaradi magnetnega polja in radijskih valov oddajajo neznatne radijske signale. Leta 1970 je doktor medicine in znanstveni raziskovalec Raymond Damadian utemeljil uporabo magnetne resonance kot pripomočka za medicinsko diagnostiko. Štiri leta pozneje so odobrili patent, ki je bil prvi izdani patent na svetu na področju MRI. Leta 1977 je dr. Damadian zaključil z izdelavo prve naprave za slikanje celega telesa z magnetno resonanco, ki jo je poimenoval »Neustavljiva«.
mt: MRI is based on the physical phenomenon known as nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (employed at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (at Harvard University). In this resonance, atoms emit minute radio signals due to a magnetic field and radio waves. In 1970, Dr. Raymond Damadian, a physician and scientific researcher, established the use of magnetic resonance as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, the patent was approved, which was the first issued patent in the world on MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the first whole-body imaging machine with magnetic resonance, which he named "Indomitable".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Ljudje smo daleč najbolj nadarjena vrsta za branje misli drugih. To pomeni, da smo sposobni uspešno napovedati, kaj drugi ljudje dojemajo, nameravajo, verjamejo, vedo in si želijo. Med temi zmožnostmi je najbolj pomembno razumevanje namena drugih. Ta nam omogoča, da razrešimo morebitna dvoumja fizičnih dejanj. Na primer, če bi zagledali nekoga, ki razbija okno avtomobila, bi najbrž predvidevali, da poskuša ukrasti avto nekega tujca. Če bi poskušal vlomiti v svoj avto, ker je izgubil ključe, bi ga ocenili drugače.
mt: We are farthest from the most gifted species in reading the minds of others. This means that we are able to successfully predict what others perceive, intend, believe, know, and desire. Among these abilities, the most important is understanding the intentions of others. This allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if we saw someone breaking a car window, we would probably assume that they were trying to steal a car from a foreigner. If they were trying to break into their own car, because they had lost their keys, we would assess them differently.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Čeprav ima umetna inteligenca močan prizvok znanstvene fantastike, sestavlja zelo pomembno vejo računalništva, ki se ukvarja z obnašanjem, učenjem in inteligentnim prilagajanjem stroja. Raziskave na področju AI zajemajo izdelovanje strojev za avtomatizacijo opravil, pri katerih je potrebno inteligentno obnašanje. Primeri zajemajo nadzor, načrtovanje in izdelavo urnikov, sposobnost odgovarjanja na diagnoze in vprašanja strank ter prepoznavanje pisave, glasu in obraza. Navedene stvari so postale ločene panoge, ki se osredotočajo na zagotavljanje rešitev za težave v resničnem življenju. Sistem umetne inteligence se pogosto uporablja na področju ekonomije, medicine, inženirstva in vojske, saj je vgrajen v številno programsko opremo za osebne računalnike in videoigre.
mt: Although artificial intelligence has a strong appeal in science fiction, it is a very important branch of computer science that deals with behavior, learning, and intelligent adaptation of machines. Research in AI includes the design of machines that can perform tasks that would require intelligence if done by humans. Examples include monitoring, scheduling, and making of schedules, the ability to respond to diagnoses and customer questions, and the recognition of handwriting, speech, and faces. These things have become separate fields that focus on providing solutions to problems in real life. Artificial intelligence is often used in the field of economics, medicine, engineering, and the military, as it is embedded in a lot of software for personal computers and video games.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Vzorci konvergentnega mišljenja so tehnike reševanja problemov, ki za iskanje rešitve združujejo različne ideje ali polja. V središču te miselnosti so hitrost, logika in natančnost, pa tudi prepoznavanje dejstev, ponovna uporaba obstoječih prijemov, zbiranje informacij. Pri tej miselnosti je najpomembnejši dejavnik naslednji: obstaja samo en pravilen odgovor. Domislite se lahko le dveh odgovorov, in sicer pravilnega ali napačnega. Ta način razmišljanja je povezan z določenimi znanstvenimi ali standardnimi postopki. Ljudje, ki razmišljajo na tak način, so si sposobni zapomniti vzorce, reševati probleme in delati z znanstvenimi besedili.
mt: Convergent thinking techniques are problem-solving techniques that combine different ideas or fields to find a solution. Speed, logic, and accuracy, as well as recognizing facts, reusing existing receptions, gathering information. The most important factor in this way of thinking is this: there is only one correct answer. You can only think of two answers, either correct or incorrect. This way of thinking is connected to certain scientific or standard procedures. People who think in this way are able to remember patterns, solve problems, and work with scientific literature.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Snemanje videoposnetkov je omogočilo pomembna odkritja pri razlaganju mikropotez, obraznih gibov, ki trajajo le nekaj milisekund. Pravijo zlasti, da naj bi bilo s pravilnim tolmačenjem mikroizrazov mogoče zaznati, ali oseba laže. Oliver Sacks je v svojem članku Predsednikov govor pojasnil, da so ljudje, ki zaradi možganske poškodbe ne morejo razumeti govora, kljub temu sposobni natančno oceniti iskrenost. Predpostavlja celo, da imajo takšne sposobnosti tolmačenja človeškega vedenja tudi živali, kot so domači psi.
mt: Videography has allowed important discoveries in the analysis of microexpressions, facial movements that last only a few milliseconds. They say especially that it would be possible to detect whether a person is lying by proper interpretation of micro-expressions. Oliver Sacks explained in his article The President's Speech that people who are unable to understand speech due to brain damage are nevertheless able to accurately assess sincerity. He even suggests that such interpretation abilities of human behavior have animals, such as domestic dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Kot je že zgoraj zapisano, so se možnosti pridobivanja znanja in učenja zelo spremenile, zato se je spremenila tudi hitrost pridobivanja znanja. Obstajalo je več različnih načinov pridobivanja informacij. Poudarek ni bil več toliko na posameznem priklicu, ampak na zmožnosti priklica besedila. V renesansi so uvedli predvsem bistvene spremembe v pristopu do učenja in prenašanju znanja.
mt: As previously stated, the speed of acquiring knowledge has changed, so has the speed of acquiring knowledge. There were several different ways of acquiring information. The emphasis was no longer so much on individual recall, but on the ability to recall text. In the Renaissance, they introduced mainly changes in the approach to learning and the transmission of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Internet združuje tako elemente masovne kot medosebne komunikacije. Svojstvene značilnosti interneta omogočajo nove razsežnosti v smislu uporabe in pristopa do nagrajevanja. Na primer, »učenje« in »socializacija« naj bi bila pomembna motivatorja za uporabo interneta (James et al., 1995). »Osebno udeleženost« in »stalne odnose« sta kot nova vidika motivacije prepoznala tudi Eighmey in McCord (1998), ko sta preučevala, kako se publika odziva na spletne strani.
mt: The Internet combines elements of mass and interpersonal communication. Its unique characteristics allow new dimensions in terms of use and approach to reward. For example, "learning" and "socialization" are believed to be important motivators for Internet use (James et al., 1995). "Personal involvement" and "stable relationships" are new perspectives of motivation recognized by Eighmey and McCord (1998), when they studied how the public responds to web sites.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gotski slog je vrhunec doživel v obdobju med 10. in 11. stoletjem ter v 14. stoletju. Na začetku je imela obleka na vzhodu močan pridih bizantinske kulture. Zaradi počasnih komunikacijskih povezav pa so slogi na zahodu lahko zaostajali od 25 do 30 let. Proti koncu srednjega veka so v zahodni Evropi začeli oblikovati lasten slog. Eden največjih napredkov tistega časa in rezultat križarskih vojn je, da so za zapenjanje oblačil začeli uporabljati gumbe.
mt: Gothic fashion reached its peak in the period between the 10th and 11th centuries and in the 14th century. At the beginning, the dress had a strong Byzantine influence from the east. Due to slow communication links, however, fashions in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 years. Towards the end of the Middle Ages, people in Western Europe began to develop their own style. One of the greatest advances of that time and the result of the Crusades was that they began to use buttons for fastening clothes.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Naše življenje lahko postane prijaznejše do okolja, pridružimo se lahko gibanju za varovanje okolja, lahko celo postanemo aktivisti, da bi do neke mere zmanjšali trpljenje v prihodnosti. To je v veliko primerih podobno simptomatičnemu zdravljenju. Vendar če ne želimo le začasne rešitve, moramo poiskati srž težave in jo odpraviti. Povsem očitno je, da se je svet izjemno spremenil zaradi znanstvenega in tehnološkega napredka človeštva, težave pa so se povečale tudi zaradi prenaseljenosti in človekovega potratnega življenjskega sloga.
mt: Our lives can become more friendly to the environment, we can join the movement to protect the environment, we can even become activists, to reduce suffering in the future to some extent. This is often similar to symptomatic treatment. However, if we do not want just a temporary solution, we must seek the root of the problem and eliminate it. It is quite obvious that the world has changed greatly due to scientific and technological progress of mankind, but the problems have also increased due to overpopulation and the human lifestyle of extravagance.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Ravnovesje moči je bil sistem, prek katerega so evropski narodi poskušali ohraniti državno suverenost vseh evropskih držav. Po tem konceptu so morale vse evropske države paziti na to, da ne bi ena prevladala, zato so državne vlade pogosto spremenile svoja zavezništva in s tem ohranila ravnovesje. Španska nasledstvena vojna je bila prva vojna, ki se je odvila zaradi nesorazmerja moči. To je naznanjalo pomembno spremembo, saj je izničilo izgovor evropskih sil, da gre za verske vojne. Zato je bila tridesetletna vojna tudi zadnja vojna, ki je bila znana kot verska vojna.
mt: The balance of power was a system by which European nations sought to preserve the sovereign equality of all European states. Under this concept, all European governments were to watch that one did not predominate, and governments often changed their alliances to maintain the balance. The Spanish Succession was the first war fought because of an imbalance of power. This marked a major change, as it invalidated the excuse of European powers that it was a religious war. Thus, the Thirty Years' War was also the last war known as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: V tem obdobju evropske zgodovine je pod drobnogled prišla katoliška Cerkev, ki je obogatela in razširila svojo oblast. Krščanska vera je več kot tisočletje povezovala evropske države kljub razlikam v jeziku in navadah. Jaz Njena vseprisotna moč je vplivala tako na kralje kot navadne ljudi. Ena od glavnih krščanskih doktrin je, da je treba bogastvo uporabiti za lajšanje trpljenja in revščine ter da so denarna sredstva cerkve namenjena ravno temu. Sedež osrednje avtoritete cerkve ima sedež v Rimu že več kot tisoč let in ta koncentracija moči in denarja je mnoge pripeljala do dvoma, ali res sledi temu načelu.
mt: In this period of European history, the Catholic Church has come under scrutiny, having enriched and expanded its authority. Christian faith has united European countries for more than a thousand years despite differences in language and customs. I, Your Almighty Power, have influenced both kings and ordinary people. One of the main Christian doctrines is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the Church's monetary resources are intended for just that. The seat of the central authority of the Church has been in Rome for more than a thousand years and this concentration of power and money has led many to doubt whether this doctrine is actually followed.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Prestrašenega kralja Ludvika XVI., kraljico Marijo Antoaneto, njuna mlada otroka (11-letno Marijo Terezo in štiriletnega Ludvika Karla) ter kraljevo sestro, gospo Elizabeto, je razjarjena množica branjevk prisilila, da so se 6. oktobra 1789 iz Versaillesa umaknili v Pariz. V Pariz so se vračali s kočijo, obdano z množico ljudi, ki je vpila in kričala grožnje kralju in kraljici. Množica ljudi je kralja in kraljico prisilila k temu, da sta na stežaj odprla okna kočije. V nekem trenutku je nekdo iz množice pred prestrašeno kraljico pomahal z glavo pripadnika kraljeve straže, ubitega v Versaillesu.
mt: 6 October 1789, an angry mob forced the terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their young children (11-year-old Marie Thérèse and four-year-old Louis Charles) and the king's sister, Madame Élisabeth, to leave Versailles for Paris. They returned to Paris in a carriage surrounded by a mob who booed and shouted threats at the king and queen. The mob forced the king and queen to open the carriage windows. At one point, someone from the mob slapped the head of a member of the king's guard, killed in Versailles, in front of the terrified queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Prestrašenega kralja Ludvika XVI., kraljico Marijo Antoaneto, njuna mlada otroka (11-letno Marijo Terezo in štiriletnega Ludvika Karla) ter kraljevo sestro, gospo Elizabeto, je razjarjena množica branjevk prisilila, da so se 6. oktobra 1789 iz Versaillesa umaknili v Pariz. V Pariz so se vračali s kočijo, obdano z množico ljudi, ki je vpila in kričala grožnje kralju in kraljici. Množica ljudi je kralja in kraljico prisilila k temu, da sta na stežaj odprla okna kočije. V nekem trenutku je nekdo iz množice pred prestrašeno kraljico pomahal z glavo pripadnika kraljeve straže, ubitega v Versaillesu.

src: Kmalu po izbruhu sovražnosti je Britanija vzpostavila pomorsko blokado Nemčije. Strategija, s katero so prekinili najpomembnejšo vojaško in civilno oskrbo, se je izkazala za učinkovito, vendar pa je ta blokada prekršila splošno sprejeto mednarodno pravo, ki je kodificirano z več mednarodnimi dogovori zadnjih dveh stoletij. Velika Britanija je minirala mednarodne vode, da bi ladjam preprečila dostop do celotnih območij oceana, s čimer je ogrožala tudi nevtralne ladje. Ker je bil odgovor na to taktiko omejen, je Nemčija pričakovala podoben odgovor na neomejeno podmorsko bojevanje.
mt: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain established a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy, which cut off the most important military and civilian supplies, proved effective, but this blockade violated the general accepted international law, which is codified by several international treaties of the last two centuries. Great Britain mined international waters to prevent ships from accessing entire ocean areas, endangering even neutral ships. Because the response to this tactic was limited, Germany expected a similar response to unlimited submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: V Združenih državah Amerike je približno 400.000 poznanih primerov multiple skleroze (MS), zaradi česar je to vodilna nevrološka bolezen mlajših odraslih in odraslih v srednjih letih. MS je bolezen, ki prizadene osrednji živčni sistem, in sicer možgane, hrbtenjačo in vidni živec. Raziskave kažejo, da so ženske dvakrat bolj nagnjene k MS kot moški.
mt: 400,000 known cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) in the United States, making it the leading neurological disorder of young adults and adults in middle age. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, specifically the brain, spinal cord and optic nerve. Research shows that women are twice as likely to be susceptible to MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Študija je pokazala da so depresija, strah in katastrofiranje posledica razmerja med bolečino in invalidnostjo pri tistih, ki trpijo bolečine v hrbtu. Z rednimi tedensko strukturiranimi sklopi telesne dejavnosti so bile pogojene le posledice katastrofiranja, ne pa tudi depresije in strahu. Tisti, ki so se redno ukvarjali s kakršno koli fizično dejavnostjo, so potrebovali več podpore v smislu negativnega dojemanja bolečine, pri čemer so morali prepoznati razliko med kronično bolečino in nelagodjem od običajnega fizičnega gibanja.
mt: A study showed that depression, fear and catastrophizing are the result of the ratio of pain and disability in those who suffer back pain. With regular weekly structured physical activity, the consequences of catastrophizing were conditioned, not depression and fear. Those who were regularly engaged in any physical activity needed more support in terms of negative perception of pain, having to recognize the difference between chronic pain and discomfort from normal physical movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Sabljanje je danes šport, ki ga igrajo na različnih nivojih, od študentov, ki se ga učijo na univerzi, do udejstvovanja na profesionalnih in olimpijskih tekmovanjih. Ta šport se večinoma igra v obliki dvoboja, en mečevalec se bojuje z drugim.
mt: Fencing is today a sport played at various levels, from students who learn it at university, to involvement in professional and Olympic competitions. This sport is usually played in the form of a duel, one fencer fights with another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Notranja zastrupitev ni vedno najbolj očitna. Znaki, kot je bruhanje, so dovolj splošni, da ni mogoče podati takojšnje diagnoze. Glavni znak, ki kaže na notranjo zastrupitev, je morebitna prisotnost odprte embalaže z zdravili ali strupenih gospodinjskih kemikalij. Na nalepki preverite, ali so točno za ta strup navedena specifična navodila za prvo pomoč.
mt: Internal poisoning is not always obvious. Signs such as vomiting are too general to provide an immediate diagnosis. The main sign of internal poisoning is the possible presence of an open package of drugs or poisonous household chemicals. Check the label to see if specific first aid instructions for this poison are provided.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Da bi lahko pregledali žrtev, morate zaradi lastne varnosti najprej preiskati prizorišče. Ko se približuješ žrtvi, moraš biti pozoren na njegov ali njen položaj in na vse, kar bi lahko izstopalo. Če se med nudenjem pomoči poškodujete, lahko vse skupaj samo še poslabšate.
mt: In order to examine the victim, you must first inspect the scene for your own safety. When approaching the victim, you must be aware of their position and anything that may protrude. If you are injured while rendering aid, you can only make things worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Družbenih in političnih učinkov je veliko, na primer uporaba metričnega sistema, prehod iz absolutizma v republikanizem, nacionalizem in prepričanje, da država pripada ljudstvu, in ne enemu samemu vladarju. Poleg tega so bili poklici po revoluciji odprti do vseh iskalcev moškega spola, kar je omogočalo, da uspejo najbolj ambiciozni in uspešni. To velja tudi za vojsko, saj so vojaški čini namesto na razredu zdaj osnovani na kalibru. Francoska revolucija je dala navdih tudi številnim drugim zatiranim pripadnikov delavskega razreda iz drugih držav, da so začeli svoje revolucije.
mt: The social and political effects were many, for example, the use of the metric system, the transition from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism, and the belief that the state belongs to the people, not to one single ruler. In addition, the professions were opened to all male seekers after the revolution, allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. This also applies to the military, as military ranks are now based on caliber instead of rank. The French Revolution gave inspiration to many other oppressed members of the working class from other countries to begin their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: V družbi vsi sodelujejo in uporabljajo sisteme prevoza. Skoraj vsi se nad sistemi prevoza pritožujejo. V razvitih državah redko slišite podobne pritožbe glede kakovosti vode ali rušenja mostov. Zakaj je na račun sistemov prevoza toliko pritožb, zakaj jim vsak dan spodleti? Ali je kriva nesposobnost prometnih inženirjev? Ali pa gre morda za nekaj bolj temeljnega?
mt: In the company of all, we all use and abuse transportation systems. Almost all complain about the quality of transportation. In developed countries, you rarely hear similar complaints about the quality of water or the collapse of bridges. Why are there so many complaints about transportation systems, why do they fail every day? Is it the incompetence of transportation engineers? Or maybe something more fundamental?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: V družbi vsi sodelujejo in uporabljajo sisteme prevoza. Skoraj vsi se nad sistemi prevoza pritožujejo. V razvitih državah redko slišite podobne pritožbe glede kakovosti vode ali rušenja mostov. src: Pretok prometa je proučevanje premikanja posameznih voznikov in vozil med dvema točkama in interakcij, ki jih imajo med seboj. Žal je proučevanje pretoka prometa težko, saj se voznikovega obnašanja ne da napovedati s 100-odstotno gotovostjo. K sreči je vedenje voznikov praviloma do neke mere ustaljeno, zato so ustaljeni tudi prometni tokovi in jih je v grobem možno predstaviti v matematični obliki. Za boljšo ponazoritev pretoka prometa so se uveljavila razmerja med glavnimi tremi značilnostmi: (1) pretokom, (2) gostoto in (3) hitrostjo. Ta razmerja pomagajo pri načrtovanju, oblikovanju in delovanju cestišč.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they have with each other. Unfortunately, traffic flow is difficult to study, as a driver's behavior cannot be predicted with 100% certainty. Fortunately, driver behavior is usually somewhat consistent, so traffic flows are also consistent and can be roughly represented in a mathematical form. To better represent traffic flow, three main characteristics have been established: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and operating roadways.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Poskus Hershey in Chase je bil eden od glavnih namigov, da je DNK genetski material. Hershey in Chase sta lastno DNK v bakterijo vsadila s pomočjo fagov oziroma virusov. Izvedli so dva poskusa, kjer so označili DNK v fagu z radioaktivnim fosforjem ali beljakovino faga z radioaktivnim žveplom.
mt: Hershey and Chase's experiment was one of the main clues that DNA is genetic material. Hershey and Chase injected their own DNA into a bacterium using phages, or viruses. They performed two experiments, where they labeled the DNA in the phage with radioactive phosphorus or the phage's protein with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Učinki mutacij so lahko zelo različni, kar je odvisno od vrste mutacije, pomembnosti prizadetega dela genetskega materiala in tega, ali so prizadete klične celice. Na otroke se lahko prenesejo le mutacije kličnih celic, drugod pa lahko mutacije povzročijo celično smrt ali raka.
mt: The effects of mutations can be very different, depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected part of the genetic material, and whether the affected cells are stem cells. Only mutations of stem cells can be passed on to children, elsewhere mutations can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Koze naj bi prvič udomačili pred približno 10.000 leti v gorovju Zagros v Iranu. Starodavne kulture in plemena so jih začela gojiti za enostaven dostop do mleka, dlake, mesa ter kože. Domače koze so bile večinoma v čredah, ki so tavale po hribih ali drugih pašnih območjih, zanje pa so pogosto skrbeli kozji pastirji, ki so neredko bili otroci ali mladostniki, podobno kot bolj znani ovčji pastirji. Ti načini upravljanja čred se uporabljajo še danes.
mt: Goats were first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to breed them for easy access to milk, wool, meat and skin. Domestic goats were usually in herds that roamed the hills or other grazing areas, and were often tended by goat herders, who were often children or young people, similar to the more well-known sheep herders. These methods of herd management are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf je igra, pri kateri igralci s palicami udarjajo žogice, da bi jih spravili v luknje. V običajni rundi se igra osemnajst lukenj, pri čemer igralci ponavadi začnejo pri prvi luknji na igrišču, končajo pa pri osemnajsti. Igralec, ki za dokončanje steze potrebuje najmanj udarcev ali zamahov s palico, zmaga. Igra poteka na travi, trava okoli luknje pa je pokošena bolj na kratko in se imenuje zelenica.
mt: Golf is a game in which players hit balls with clubs to get them into holes. In a normal round, players play 18 holes, usually starting at the first hole on the course and ending at the eighteenth. The player who completes the course in the fewest strokes or swings with the club wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is cut shorter and is called the green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Glavni cilj znanosti je s pomočjo znanstvene metode ugotoviti, kako svet deluje. Ta metoda pravzaprav vodi večino znanstvenih raziskav. A to še ni vse, pomemben del znanstvenega raziskovanja so namreč tudi preizkušanje, kjer je preizkus test, ki je namenjen izločanju ene ali več možnih hipotez, zastavljanje vprašanj in opazovanje.
mt: The main goal of science is to use the scientific method to determine how the world works. This method in fact leads most scientific research. But that's not all, an important part of scientific research are also experiments, where an experiment is a test designed to eliminate one or more possible hypotheses, posing questions and observing.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Tornadi sicer v primerjavi z drugimi silovitimi nevihtami prizadenejo le majhno območje, uničijo pa vse pred seboj. Tornadi izkoreninjajo drevesa, z zgradb trgajo deske in mečejo avtomobile v zrak. Najsilovitejša dva odstotka tornadov trajata več kot tri ure. Ti siloviti viharji vsebujejo vetrove s hitrostjo do 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: Tornadoes, in comparison to other violent storms, affect only a small area, but destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes strip trees, tear off shingles and hurl cars through the air. The most powerful two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These violent storms contain winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Ljudje že tisoče let izdelujejo in uporabljajo leče za povečavo. Prve prave teleskope so izdelovali v Evropi konec 16. stoletja. Pri teh teleskopih se je za približevanje in povečavo oddaljenih predmetov uporabljalo kombinacijo dveh leč.
mt: People have been making and using lenses to magnify for thousands of years. The first true telescopes were made in Europe at the end of the 16th century. In these telescopes, the magnification and focusing of distant objects was achieved by combining two lenses.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Mohameda so silno zanimale stvari onkraj tega zemeljskega življenja. Obiskoval je jamo, poznano pod imenom »Hira« na gori »Nur« (svetloba), da bi premišljeval. sama jama, ki je preživela preizkus časa, daje zelo jasno predstavo o Mohamedovih duhovnih težnjah. Jama, ki se nahaja na vrhu ene od gora severno od Meke, je popolnoma odmaknjena od ostalega sveta. V bistvu je ni enostavno najti, tudi če vemo, da obstaja. Notranjost jame pa nudi popolno samoto. Razen jasnega, čudovitega neba nad glavo in številnih okoliških gora ni mogoče videti nič drugega. Iz notranjosti jame se vidi ali sliši le malo iz tega sveta.
mt: Mohamed was very interested in things beyond this earthly life. He visited the cave known as "Hira" on the mountain "Nur" (light), to meditate. The cave, which survived the test of time, gives a very clear picture of Mohamed's spiritual aspirations. The cave, located at the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find it, even if we know it exists. The interior of the cave offers complete solitude. Except for the clear, beautiful sky above his head and numerous surrounding mountains, nothing else can be seen or heard from this world. From the interior of the cave, one can see or hear only a little from this world.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: V Angliji so bile tirnice zgrajene že v 16. stoletju. Čeprav so bile proge za vagone sestavljene zgolj iz vzporednih desk, so zaradi njih konji, ki so jih vlekli, lahko dosegli večje hitrosti in vlekli večja bremena kot na takratnih nekoliko slabših cestah. Dokaj kmalu so začeli uporabljati pragove, da so tiri ostali na mestu. Postopoma pa so ugotovili, da so tiri bolj učinkoviti, če imajo na vrhu trak železa. To je postala vsesplošna praksa, vendar so se zaradi železa hitreje obrabila lesena kolesa na vagonih. Lesena kolesa so sčasoma nadomestili z železnimi. Leta 1767 so uvedli prve tirnice, ki so bile v celoti iz železa.
mt: In England, the first turnpikes were built in the 16th century. Although the tracks for the wagons were only made of planks, the horses pulling them could achieve greater speeds and pull greater loads than on the then somewhat inferior roads. Soon they began to use the rails, so that the tracks would stay in place. Gradually, it was found that the tracks were more effective if they had a strip of iron on top. This became general practice, but because of the iron the wooden wheels on the wagons wore out faster. Wooden wheels were eventually replaced by iron ones. In 1767, the first iron tracks were introduced.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
