src: Čeprav bi se nam njihova hrana večinoma zdela znana, pa so imeli Rimljani imeli kar precej čudnih ali nenavadnih prazničnih jedi, vključno z divjim prašičem, pavom, polži in vrsto glodavca, ki se imenuje polh. Še ena razlika je bila v tem, da medtem ko so revni in ženske pri obedovanju sedeli na stolih, so bogati možje svoje pojedine raje uživali skupaj, pri čemer so med obedovanjem poležavali na boku. Starorimski obroki niso mogli vsebovati hrane, ki je iz Amerike ali Azije v Evropo prišla v kasnejših stoletjih. Na primer, niso imeli ne koruze, ne paradižnikov, ne krompirja, ne kakava in noben antični Rimljan ni nikoli poskusil puranjega mesa.
mt: Although their food would be mostly familiar to us, the Romans had a number of strange or unusual holiday dishes, including wild boar, peacock, snails and a species of rodent called the dormouse. Another difference was that while the poor and women ate at tables, the rich men preferred to eat together, lying on couches while dining. The ancient Roman meals could not have included food that came from America or Asia to Europe in later centuries. For example, they did not have corn, pears, potatoes, coffee, and no ancient Roman ever tried pork.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Civilizacija je edinstvena kultura, ki je skupna veliki skupini posameznikov, ki skupaj živijo in sodelujejo, družba. Beseda civilizacija izhaja iz latinske besede civilis, ki pomeni državljanski in je sorodna latinski besedi civis, ki pomeni državljan, ter civitas, ki pomeni mesto ali mestno državo, kar na nek način označuje tudi velikost družbe. Mestne države so predhodnice narodov. Kultura civilizacije vključuje predajanje znanja skozi generacije, trajno kulturno sled in znatno razširjenost. Manjše kulture pogosto izginejo, ne da bi za seboj pustile pomembne zgodovinske sledi, zato jih ni mogoče obravnavati kot prave civilizacije.
mt: A civilization is a unique culture shared by a large group of individuals who live and work together, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin word civilis, which means civic and is related to the Latin word civis, which means citizen, and civitas, which means city or city-state, which in some way also indicates the size of the society. City-states are precursors of nations. The culture of civilization includes the transmission of knowledge through generations, a lasting cultural trail, and a significant spread. Smaller cultures often die out without leaving important historical trails, so they cannot be considered true civilizations.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong je porušena utrdba in budistični samostan v zgornjem delu okrožja Paro (v vasi Phodney). Leta 1649 naj bi Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel zgradil graščino v počastitev spomina na svojo zmago nad tibetansko-mongolskimi silami. Leta 1951 je zaradi požara ostalo le nekaj ostankov Drukgyal Dzonga, kot je na primer slika šabdrunga Ngavanga Namgjala. Po požaru so trdnjavo ohranili in zaščitili, in tako ostaja ena najbolj senzacionalnih atrakcij Butana.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper Paro valley (in the village of Phodrang). In 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal is said to have built a fort in memory of his victory over the Tibetan-Mongolian forces. In 1951, due to a fire, only a few remains of Drukgyal Dzong remained, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, and thus remains one of the most sensational attractions of Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: V 18. stoletju se je Kambodža znašla sredi pritiskov svojih močnih sosed, Tajske in Vietnama. Tajci so v 18. stoletju večkrat napadli Kambodžo in leta 1772 tudi uničili Phnom Phen. V zadnjih letih 18. stoletja so Vietnamci napadli tudi Kambodžo.
mt: 18th century Cambodia found itself in the midst of pressure from its powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais had attacked Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 had even destroyed Phnom Penh. In the last years of the 18th century, the Vietnamese also attacked Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: V 18. stoletju se je Kambodža znašla sredi pritiskov svojih močnih sosed, Tajske in Vietnama. Tajci so v 18. stoletju večkrat napadli Kambodžo in leta 1772 tudi uničili Phnom Phen. V zadnjih letih 18. stoletja so Vietnamci napadli tudi Kambodžo.

src: Začetki Tajvana segajo v 15. stoletje, ko so ga evropski pomorščaki, ki so pluli mimo otoka, poimenovali Ilha Formosa ali lepi otok. Leta 1624 je Nizozemska vzhodnoindijska družba postavila bazo v jugozahodnem Tajvanu in začela s preobrazbo domorodnih načinov pridelave žit in zaposlovanjem kitajskih delavcev za delo na plantažah riža in sladkorja. Leta 1683 so vojaške sile dinastije Čing (1644–1912) prevzele nadzor nad tajvansko zahodno in severno obalo in leta 1885 razglasile Tajvan za provinco imperija Čing. Leta 1895 je vlada dinastije Čing po porazu v prvi kitajsko-japonski vojni (1894–1895) podpisala sporazum v Šimonoseki, s katerim je oblast nad Tajvanom predala Japonski, ki je na otoku vladala do leta 1945.
mt: The origins of Taiwan date back to the 15th century, when European sailors who sailed past the island named it Ilha Formosa or beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan and began transforming indigenous farming methods and employing Chinese laborers for work on rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, the military forces of the Qing dynasty (1644–1912) took control of Taiwan's western and northern coast and in 1885 declared Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire. In 1895, the Qing government, after losing the First Sino-Japanese War (1894–1895), signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, which ceded control of Taiwan to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Temu rečemo pH kemikalije. Indikator lahko izdelate že s sokom rdečega zelja. Zeljni sok spreminja barvo glede na kislost ali bazičnost (alkalnost) kemikalije. PH vrednost preskušanih kemikalij se določi s količino vodikovih (H v pH) ionov. Vodikovi ioni so protoni, ki so jim odvzeli elektrone (vodikovi atomi so namreč sestavljeni iz enega protona in enega elektrona).
mt: We call this pH chemicals. You can make the indicator already with the juice of red beet. Beet juice changes color depending on the acidity or basicity (alkalinity) of the chemical. The pH value of the tested chemicals is determined by the amount of hydrogen (H in pH) ions. Hydrogen ions are protons, which have been stripped of electrons (hydrogen atoms are composed of one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Levi so najbolj družabne mačke in živijo v velikih skupinah, ki jim pravimo krdela. V krdelu so eden do trije samci, ki so v sorodu, in vse do trideset samic in mladičev. Kot velika družina sester in hčera so ženske običajno med sabo tesno povezane. Krdelo levov se obnaša zelo podobno kot krdelo volkov ali psov, živali, ki so po vedenju presenetljivo podobne levom (vendar ne ostalim velikim mačkam) in pa tudi zelo smrtonosne za svoj plen.
mt: Leopards are the most social of the big cats and live in groups called prides. A pride consists of one to three closely related males and up to 30 females and cubs. As a large family of sisters and daughters, females are usually closely bonded with each other. A pride of leopards behaves very similarly to a pride of wolves or dogs, animals that are surprisingly similar in behavior to leopards (but not other large cats) and also very deadly to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Pod njimi so bolj srednje velike mačke, ki jedo srednje velik plen, vse od zajcev do antilop in jelenov. Obstajajo pa tudi številne majhne mačke (vključno s prosto živečimi domačimi mačkami), ki se prehranjujejo z veliko številčnejšim plenom, kot so žuželke, glodavci, kuščarji in ptice. Skrivnost njihovega uspeha je v konceptu niše, posebno delo, ki ga ima posamezna mačka, ki jo varuje pred tekmovanjem z drugimi.
mt: Beneath them are the larger medium-sized cats, which eat medium-sized prey, from rabbits to antelopes and deer. There are also numerous small cats (including free-ranging domestic cats), which feed on a much larger prey, such as insects, rodents, lizards and birds. The secret of their success is in the concept of niche, a special work that each cat has, which protects it from competition with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Ozeloti se prehranjujejo z majhnimi živalmi. Če le lahko, lovijo opice, kače, glodavce in ptice. Skoraj vse živali, ki jih ozelot lovi, so precej manjše od njega. Znanstveniki mislijo, da ozeloti zasledujejo in iščejo živali za hrano (plen) s pomočjo voha, saj vohajo, kje na tleh so se zadrževale. Zaradi nočnega vida lahko ponoči zelo dobro vidijo in se tudi neslišno premikajo. Ozeloti plenijo tako, da se najprej zlijejo z okolico, nato pa skočijo na plen.
mt: Ocelots eat small animals. If they can, they hunt monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds. Almost all animals that ocelots hunt are much smaller than them. Scientists think that ocelots track and search for animals for food (prey) with the help of their whiskers, as they whisker where the animals have been resting on the ground. Because of their night vision, they can see very well at night and also move very quietly. Ocelots hunt by first lying down in the area, then jumping on the prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Tiger je dober atlet in lahko pleza (čeprav ne najbolje), plava, preskoči velike razdalje in vleče petkrat močneje kot močan človek. Tiger spada v isto skupino (rod Panthera) kot levi, leopardi in jaguarji. Ti štirje predstavniki velikih mačk so edini, ki lahko rjovijo. Tigrovo rjovenje ni tako polno in enotno kot levje, ampak bolj odrezano renčeče in kričeče.
mt: The tiger is a good athlete and can climb (though not very well), swim, jump great distances, and pull five times as much as a strong man. The tiger belongs to the same group (genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four representatives of the big cats are the only ones that can roar. Tiger's roaring is not as full and unified as lion's, but rather a clipped yelping and barking.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Celica je najmanjša gradbena in funkcionalna enota živega organizma (bitja). Celica izvira iz latinske besede cella, ki pomeni majhen prostor. Če živa bitja gledate pod mikroskopom, boste videli, da so sestavljena iz kvadratkov ali kroglic. Robert Hooke, biolog iz Anglije, je v pluti pod mikroskopom videl majhne kvadrate. Videti so bili kot prostori. Bil je prvi človek, ki je opazoval mrtve celice.
mt: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of an organism. It comes from the Latin word cella, meaning small room. When you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made up of squares or circles. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares when he looked at dead cells under a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Živali so narejene iz veliko celic. Jejo stvari in jih prebavljajo v sebi. Večina živali se lahko premika. Možgane imajo samo živali (a niti ne vse živali; na primer, meduze nimajo možganov). Živali so prisotne po vsej Zemlji. Kopljejo v tla, plavajo v oceanih in letijo po nebu.
mt: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside themselves. Most animals can move. Brains are only in animals (and not all animals; for example, jellyfish don't have brains). Animals are present all over the Earth. They dig in the dirt, swim in the oceans and fly in the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Rastline ustvarjajo kisik, ki ga ljudje dihajo, in sprejemajo ogljikov dioksid, ki ga ljudje iztisnejo iz pljuč (oziroma izdihnejo). Rastline s fotosintezo pridelujejo hrano s pomočjo sonca. Prav tako ponujajo senco. Iz rastlin izdelujemo svoje hiše in oblačila. Večino hrane, ki jo pojemo, je iz rastlin. Živali ne bi mogle preživeti brez rastlin.
mt: Plants create oxygen, which humans breathe, and absorb carbon dioxide, which humans exhale (or breathe out). Plants produce food with the help of the sun. They also provide shade. We make our houses and clothes from plants. Most of the food we eat is from plants. Animals would not survive without plants.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Ko se majhna skupina živih organizmov (majhna populacija) oddalji od glavne populacije, iz katere izhaja (na primer, če se preseli prek gorske verige ali reke ali se preseli na nov otok in se je težko vrniti), se bo pogosto znašla v drugačnem okolju kot je živela prej. To novo okolje ima drugačne vire in konkurente, zato bo nova populacija potrebovala drugačne lastnosti ali prilagoditve, da se bo lahko kosala z njimi. Izvorna populacija se ni nikakor spremenila, še vedno potrebujejo iste prilagoditve kot prej. Ko se začne nova populacija prilagajati na novo okolje, je sčasoma vse manj podobna drugi populaciji. Sčasoma, čez več tisoč ali celo milijonov let, si bosta populaciji na videz tako različni, da ju ne bo mogoče šteti za isto vrsto. Temu procesu rečemo speciacija, kar pomeni nastajanje novih vrst. Speciacija je neizogibna posledica in zelo pomemben del evolucije.
mt: When a small group of living organisms (a small population) moves away from the main population it came from (for example, if it migrates over a mountain range or river or moves to a new island and it is difficult to return), it will often find itself in a different environment than it lived in before. This new environment has different resources and competitors, so the new population will need different traits or adaptations to be able to compete with them. The original population has not changed in any way, it still needs the same adaptations as before. As the new population begins to adapt to the new environment, it is eventually less and less similar to the other population. Eventually, over millions of years, the populations will look so different that they cannot be considered the same species. This process is called speciation, which means the creation of new species. Speciation is an inevitable result and very important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Najpomembnejši organ obtočilnega sistema je srce, ki črpa kri. Kri potuje iz srca po žilah, imenovanih arterije, in se vrne v srce po žilah, imenovanih vene. Najmanjše žile se imenujejo kapilare.
mt: The most important organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood travels from the heart through arteries, and returns to the heart through veins. The smallest vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Najpomembnejši organ obtočilnega sistema je srce, ki črpa kri. Kri potuje iz srca po žilah, imenovanih arterije, in se vrne v srce po žilah, imenovanih vene. Najmanjše žile se imenujejo kapilare.
mt: The most important organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood travels from the heart through arteries, and returns to the heart through veins. The smallest vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Žuželke so bile prve živali, ki so vzletele. Zaradi zmožnosti letenja so se spretneje izogibali sovražnikom in učinkoviteje iskali hrano ter partnerje za parjenje. Večina insektov ima to prednost, da lahko krila zložijo vzdolž svojega telesa. To jim omogoča še več možnosti skrivanja pred plenilci. Danes so edine žuželke, ki kril ne morejo zložiti ob telo, kačji pastirji in enodnevnice.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. Because of their ability to fly, they were better able to avoid enemies and more effectively find food and mates for mating. Most insects have the advantage that they can fold their wings along their body. This allows them even more possibilities of hiding from predators. Today, only the chameleons and the one-day flies are insects that cannot fold their wings along their body.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Danes veliko paleontologov verjame, da je ena skupina dinozavrov preživela in živi še danes. Imenujemo jih ptice. Veliko ljudi jih ne dojema kot dinozavre, ker imajo perje in lahko letijo. Vseeno si ptice z dinozavri delijo veliko podobnosti. Na stopalih imajo luske in kremplje, ležejo jajca in hodijo po zadnjih dveh nogah kot tiranozavri.
mt: Today many paleontologists believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is still living today. We call them birds. Many people don't consider them to be dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. Nevertheless, birds share many similarities with dinosaurs. They have claws and crests on their toes, lay eggs, and walk on their hind legs like tyrannosaurs.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Danes veliko paleontologov verjame, da je ena skupina dinozavrov preživela in živi še danes. Imenujemo jih ptice. Veliko ljudi jih ne dojema kot dinozavre, ker imajo perje in lahko letijo. src: Triceratops je bil verjetno sposoben z zobmi poleg listja zdrobiti tudi žilave veje in korenine. Nekateri znanstveniki menijo, da so triceratopsi jedli sagovce, sorto rastline, ki je bila pogosta v Kreti. Te rastline izgledajo kot majhne palme s krono ostrih, bodičastih listov. Preden je začel jesti deblo, je triceratops verjetno odstranil listje s svojim močnim kljunom. Drugi znanstveniki trdijo, da so te rastline zelo strupene, zato je malo verjetno, da so jih dinozavri jedli, čeprav se danes lenivec in druge živali, kot je papiga (potomka dinozavra), lahko prehranjujejo s strupenimi listi ali sadeži.
mt: The Triceratops was likely able to use its horns to break off branches and roots of the ferns. Some scientists believe the Triceratops ate ferns, a common plant in Crete. These plants look like small palms with crowns of sharp, spiky leaves. Before it started eating the trunk, the Triceratops likely removed the fronds with its powerful beak. Other scientists say these plants are very poisonous, so it is unlikely that dinosaurs ate them, although today lizards and other animals, such as parrots (a descendant of the dinosaur), can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Triceratops je bil verjetno sposoben z zobmi poleg listja zdrobiti tudi žilave veje in korenine. Nekateri znanstveniki menijo, da so triceratopsi jedli sagovce, sorto rastline, ki je bila pogosta v Kreti. Te rastline izgledajo kot majhne palme s krono ostrih, bodičastih listov. Preden je začel jesti deblo, je triceratops verjetno odstranil listje s svojim močnim kljunom. Drugi znanstveniki trdijo, da so te rastline zelo strupene, zato je malo verjetno, da so jih dinozavri jedli, čeprav se danes lenivec in druge živali, kot je papiga (potomka dinozavra), lahko prehranjujejo s strupenimi listi ali sadeži.
mt: The Triceratops was likely able to use its horns to break off branches and roots of the ferns. Some scientists believe the Triceratops ate ferns, a common plant in Crete. These plants look like small palms with crowns of sharp, spiky leaves. Before it started eating the trunk, the Triceratops likely removed the fronds with its powerful beak. Other scientists say these plants are very poisonous, so it is unlikely that dinosaurs ate them, although today lizards and other animals, such as parrots (a descendant of the dinosaur), can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Italijanska nogometna reprezentanca je skupaj z nemško nogometno reprezentanco druga najuspešnejša ekipa na svetu in je leta 2006 postala svetovna prvakinja v nogometu. Priljubljeni športi vključujejo nogomet, košarko, odbojko, vaterpolo, sabljanje, ragbi, kolesarjenje, hokej, inline hokej in dirkanje F1. Zimski športi so najbolj priljubljeni v severnih pokrajinah, kjer Italijani tekmujejo na mednarodnih in olimpijskih igrah.
mt: The Italian national football team is jointly the second most successful team in the world and became world champions in football in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, fencing, rugby, cycling, hockey, inline hockey and Formula 1. Winter sports are most popular in the northern regions, where Italians compete in international and Olympic games.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luksemburg ima dolgo zgodovino, njegova neodvisnost pa se je začela leta 1839. Deli današnje Belgije so bili v preteklosti del Luksemburga, vendar so postali belgijski med belgijsko revolucijo v 1830-ih. Luksemburg je vedno poskušal ostati nevtralna država, vendar ga je tako v prvi kot drugi svetovni vojni okupirala Nemčija. Leta 1957 je Luksemburg postal ustanovna članica organizacije, ki je danes znana kot Evropska unija.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, its independence began in 1839. Parts of today's Belgium were once part of Luxembourg, but became Belgian during the Belgian Revolution in the 1830s. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country, but was occupied by Germany in both World War I and World War II. In 1957, Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is now known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Evropska Turčija (vzhodna Trakija ali Rumelija na Balkanskem polotoku) obsega 3 % države. Območje Turčije je dolgo več kot 1600 km (1000 milj) in široko več kot 800 km (500 milj), njegova oblika pa spominja na pravokotnik. Skupaj z jezeri površina Turčije znaša 783.562 kvadratnih kilometrov (300.948 kvadratnih milj), pri čemer je 755.688 kvadratnih kilometrov (291.773 kvadratnih milj) v jugozahodni Aziji in 23.764 kvadratnih kilometrov (9.174 kvadratnih milj) v Evropi. Zaradi svoje površine je Turčija 37. največja država in je približno tako velika kot Francija in Združeno kraljestvo skupaj. Turčijo s treh strani obkroža morje: Egejsko morje na zahodu, Črno morje na severu in Sredozemsko morje na jugu.
mt: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula) covers 3% of the country. The area of Turkey is longer than 1600 km (1000 miles) and wider than 800 km (500 miles), its shape resembling a rectangle. Together with lakes, the area of Turkey is 783.562 square kilometers (300.948 square miles), of which 755.688 square kilometers (291.773 square miles) in southwestern Asia and 23.764 square kilometers (9.174 square miles) in Europe. Because of its area, Turkey is the 37th largest country and is about as large as France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is surrounded by sea on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Vatikan ima približno 800 prebivalcev. Je najmanjša neodvisna država na svetu in država z najmanjšim številom prebivalcev. V Vatikanu sta zakonodaja in uradna komunikacija v italijanščini. Italijanščina je tudi vsakdanji jezik, ki ga uporablja večina delavcev v državi, medtem ko pri verskih obredih pogosto uporabljajo latinščino. Vsi državljani Vatikana so rimokatoliki.
mt: Vatican has about 800 inhabitants. It is the smallest independent state in the world and the state with the smallest number of inhabitants. In the Vatican, legislation and official communication is in Italian. Italian is also the everyday language used by most employees in the state, while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of the Vatican are Roman Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Danes se za obdelavo slik in videoposnetkov uporabljajo računalniki. Računalniki omogočajo izdelavo natančnih animacij, tovrstne animacije pa se vse več uporabljajo na področju televizije in filma. Glasbo pogosto snemajo z zmogljivimi računalniki, ki obdelujejo in mešajo zvoke.
mt: Today computers are used for processing images and video. Computers allow the creation of precise animations, such as animations that are increasingly used in the field of television and film. Music is often recorded with powerful computers that process and mix sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: V mestih Harappa in Mohenjo-daro je imela skoraj vsaka hiša stranišče na izplakovanje, ki je bilo priklopljeno na sofisticiran kanalizacijski sistem. Ostanke kanalizacijskega sistema so našli v hišah v minojskih mestih na Kreti in Santorinu v Grčiji. Stranišča so obstajala tudi v starem Egiptu, Perziji in na Kitajske. V rimski civilizaciji so bila stranišča včasih del javnih kopališč, kjer so se moški in ženske sestajali v mešanih družbah.
mt: In the cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro, almost every house had a latrine connected to a sophisticated sewer system. Remains of the sewer system were found in houses in the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. Latrines also existed in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In the Roman civilization, latrines were sometimes part of public baths, where men and women would meet in mixed company.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Rezilo na sodobnih drsalkah ima dvojni rob in je vbočeno na sredini. Robova omogočata boljši oprijem ledu, tudi kadar sta nagnjena. Ker je spodnji del rezila rahlo ukrivljen, se rob, ki pride v stik z ledom, tudi ukrivi, ko se rezilo nagne v eno ali drugo stran. To drsalcu omogoča spremembo smeri. Če se drsalke nagnejo v desno, bo drsalec zavil desno, če se drsalke nagnejo v levo, bo drsalec zavil levo.
mt: The edge of modern skis has a double bevel and is inset in the middle. The bevels allow better gliding on the ice, even when they are tilted. Because the lower part of the edge is slightly curved, the bevel that comes in contact with the ice also curves when the skis are tilted to one side or the other. This allows the skier to change direction. If the skis are tilted to the right, the skier will turn right, if the skis are tilted to the left, the skier will turn left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "Da bi se vrnili na prejšnjo raven energije, morajo sprostiti odvečno energijo, ki so jo dobili od svetlobe. To naredijo z oddajanjem drobnega delca svetlobe, imenovanega ""foton"". Znanstveniki temu procesu pravijo ""stimulirana emisija sevanja"", saj atome stimulira močna svetloba, ki povzroči emisijo fotonov svetlobe, svetloba pa je vrsta sevanja. Na sliki v nadaljevanju so prikazani atomi, ki oddajajo fotone. Fotoni so v resnici seveda precej manjši od prikazanih na sliki. Fotoni pa so še manjši od gradnikov atomov!"
mt: "To return to previous energy levels, they must release excess energy they have gained from light. They do this by emitting a small particle of light, called a "photon." Scientists call this process "stimulated emission," since atoms are stimulated by intense light to emit photons of light, which is a form of radiation. The atoms shown above are emitting photons. Photons are actually much smaller than the atoms shown. Photons are even smaller than the atoms' building blocks!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Po več sto urah delovanja žarilna nitka v žarnici sčasoma pregori in žarnica ne deluje več. V tem primeru je treba žarnico zamenjati. Pri zamenjavi žarnice je potrebna previdnost. Najprej je treba izklopiti stikalo svetila ali odklopiti kabel. To je zato, ker vas lahko elektrika, ki teče v vtičnico pri kovinskem delu žarnice, strese, če se dotaknete notranjega dela vtičnice ali kovinskega vznožja žarnice, ko je ta še deloma v vtičnici.
mt: After several hundred hours of operation, the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the bulb no longer works. In this case, the bulb needs to be replaced. When replacing the bulb, be careful. First, turn off the light switch or disconnect the cord. This is because the electricity that flows into the socket can shock you if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partially in the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Fisijska bomba deluje tako, da za združevanje jedra z veliko protoni in nevtroni potrebuje energijo. Podobno, kot bi v klanec potiskali težek voziček. Del te energije se nato sprosti s ponovno cepitvijo jedra. Nekateri atomi imajo nestabilno jedro, kar pomeni, da navadno razpadejo kar sami ali skoraj brez pomoči.
mt: A fission bomb works by forcing a nucleus with a lot of protons and neutrons together. It's like pushing a heavy cart into a ditch. Some of the energy is then released by the decay of the nucleus. Some atoms have unstable nuclei, meaning they usually decay on their own or almost without help.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Ko pokličete nekoga, ki je oddaljen tisoče milj, uporabljate satelit. Satelit v vesolju prejme klic in ga nato skoraj v trenutku odbije nazaj dol. Satelit so v vesolje poslali z raketo. Znanstveniki v vesolju uporabljajo teleskope zato, ker Zemljino ozračje popači nekaj naše svetlobe in pogleda. Za prevoz satelita ali teleskopa v vesolje je potrebna ogromna raketa, velika več kot 100 čevljev.
mt: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you use a satellite. A satellite in space receives the call and then almost instantaneously bounces it back down. A satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists in space use telescopes because Earth's atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. To transport a satellite or telescope into space requires a huge rocket, bigger than 100 feet.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Ko pokličete nekoga, ki je oddaljen tisoče milj, uporabljate satelit. Satelit v vesolju prejme klic in ga nato skoraj v trenutku odbije nazaj dol. Satelit so v vesolje poslali z raketo. Znanstveniki v vesolju uporabljajo teleskope zato, ker Zemljino ozračje popači nekaj naše svetlobe in pogleda. Za prevoz satelita ali teleskopa v vesolje je potrebna ogromna raketa, velika več kot 100 čevljev.
mt: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you use a satellite. A satellite in space receives the call and then almost instantaneously bounces it back down. A satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists in space use telescopes because Earth's atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. To transport a satellite or telescope into space requires a huge rocket, bigger than 100 feet.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Čas je nekaj, kar je povsod okoli nas, vpliva na vse kar počnemo, hkrati pa ga je težko razumeti. Čas že tisoče let preučujejo verski, filozofski in znanstveni učenjaki. Čas izkusimo kot zaporedje dogodkov, ki poteka od prihodnosti do sedanjosti in v preteklost. S časom tudi primerjamo trajanje (dolžino) dogodkov. Z opazovanjem ponavljanja cikličnega dogodka lahko sami zaznate minevanje časa. Cikličen dogodek je nekaj, kar se redno ponavlja, znova in znova.
mt: Time is something that is everywhere around us, affects everything we do, and yet is hard to understand. Time has been studied for thousands of years by religious, philosophical and scientific scholars. Time is experienced as a sequence of events, which goes from the future to the present and into the past. We also compare the duration (length) of events with time. By observing the repetition of a cyclic event, you can yourself detect the passing of time. A cyclic event is something that repeats itself, again and again.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Prestolonaslednik je po končani šoli tradicionalno šel naravnost v vojsko. Vendar pa se je Charles odpravil na Trinity College v Cambridge, kjer je študiral antropologijo in arheologijo, kasneje zgodovino, in si prislužil 2:2 (diplomo nižje druge stopnje). Charles je bil prvi član britanske kraljeve družine, ki je diplomiral.
mt: The heir to the throne traditionally went straight from school into the military. However, Charles went to Trinity College in Cambridge, where he studied anthropology and archaeology, later history, and earned a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British royal family to graduate.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Anglija je po ponovni osvojitvi Danelawa doživela dolgo obdobje miru. Leta 991 pa se je Ethelred soočil z vikinškim ladjevjem, ki je bilo večje kot katerokoli ladjevje od Guthrumovega stoletje prej. To floto je vodil Norvežan Olaf Trygvasson, ki je želel ponovno zavzeti svojo državo izpod danske oblasti. Po prvotnih vojaških neuspehih se je Ethelred uspel pogoditi z Olafom, ki se je vrnil na Norveško in poskušal pridobiti svoje kraljestvo, pri čemer je bil le deloma uspešen.
mt: 991 AD: England, after the re-conquest of the Danelaw, enjoyed a long period of peace. In 991, however, Ethelred was confronted with a Viking fleet larger than any Guthrum had ever commanded. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian who wanted to re-conquer his country from under Danish rule. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to negotiate with Olaf, who returned to Norway and tried to regain his kingdom, with only partial success.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "V 15. stoletju je bila severna Estonija pod velikim kulturnim vplivom Nemčije. Nekateri nemški menihi so želeli domačinom približati boga, zato so oblikovali estonski knjižni jezik. Temeljil je na nemški abecedi, dodan pa mu je bil znak ""Õ/õ"". Sčasoma je prišlo do spojitve številnih nemških sposojenk. Tako se je začelo obdobje razsvetljenstva."
mt: "In the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the locals, so they created the Estonian written language. It was based on the German alphabet, but the letter ""Õ/õ"" was added. Over time, many German loanwords were incorporated. Thus began the era of enlightenment."
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Okoli tega, koliko ljudi govori hindijščino, obstajajo različne ocene. Po ocenah naj bi bil nekje med drugim in četrtim mestom med najpogosteje govorjenimi jeziki na svetu. Število maternih govorcev se razlikuje glede na to, ali so upoštevana tudi zelo sorodna narečja. Ocene se gibljejo od 340 do 500 milijonov govorcev, kar 800 milijonov ljudi pa jezik razume. Hindijščina in urdujščina imata podobno besedišče, vendar različno pisavo, govorci obeh jezikov se v vsakodnevnih pogovorih lahko razumejo med seboj.
mt: There are various estimates of how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be somewhere between the second and fourth most widely spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether closely related dialects are also taken into account. Estimates range from 340 to 500 million speakers, with 800 million people understanding the language. Hindi and Urdu have similar vocabularies, but different scripts, and speakers of both languages can understand each other in everyday conversation.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: "Hangul je edina namensko izumljena abeceda, ki se danes uporablja v vsakdanjem življenju. Abecedo so izumili leta 1444 v času vladavine kralja Sejonga (1418–1450). Kralj Sejong je bil četrti kralj dinastije Joseon in je eden najbolj cenjenih. Abecedo Hangul je prvotno poimenoval Hunmin Jeongeum, kar pomeni ""pravilni zvoki za poučevanje ljudstva""."
mt: "Hangul is the only purposefully invented alphabet currently in use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418–1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon dynasty and is one of the most respected. The Hangul alphabet was originally named Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""correct sounds for the instruction of the people."""
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Obstaja veliko teorij, kako je nastal sanskrt. Ena od njih govori o selitvi Arijcev z zahoda v Indijo, ki so s seboj prinesli svoj jezik. Sanskrt je starodaven jezik in je primerljiv z v Evropi govorjeno latinščino. Prva znana knjiga na svetu je bila napisana v sanskrtu. Po nastanku Upinšad je zaradi hierarhije sanskrt preprosto utonil v pozabo. Sanskrt je zelo zapleten in bogat jezik, iz katerega izvirajo številni sodobni indijski jeziki, prav tako kot iz latinščine izvirajo evropski jeziki, kot sta francoščina in španščina.
mt: There are many theories about the origin of Sanskrit. One of them speaks of the migration of the Aryans from the west to India, bringing their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to Latin spoken in Europe. The first known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the creation of the Upanishads, Sanskrit simply fell into disuse. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, from which many modern Indian languages originate, just as Latin gave rise to European languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Kako bi name delovala gravitacija Io? Če bi stal na površju Io, bi tehtal manj kot na Zemlji. Oseba, ki na zemlji tehta 200 funtov (90 kg), bi na Io tehtal koli 36 funtov (16 kg). Tako vas težnost seveda manj vleče navzdol.
mt: How would gravity work on Io? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth would weigh 36 pounds (16 kg) on Io. So gravity would pull you less downward.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Površje Meseca je sestavljeno iz kamnov in prahu. Zunanji sloj Meseca se imenuje skorja. Na bližnji strani je skorja debela približno 70 km, na daljni pa 100 km. Pod morji je tanjša, pod višavji pa debelejša. Več morij bi lahko bilo na bližji strani, saj je skorja tanjša. Lava se je lažje dvignila na površje.
mt: The surface of the Moon is composed of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the regolith. On the near side, the regolith is about 70 km thick, and on the far side, it is about 100 km thick. It is thinner under the seas, and thicker under the highlands. There may be more seas on the near side, as the regolith is thinner. Lava is easier to rise to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: "Veliko ljudi sanja o dnevu, ko bodo ljudje lahko odpotovali na drugo zvezdo in raziskovali druge svetove, nekateri se sprašujejo, kaj je tam zunaj, nekateri verjamejo, da na drugem planetu morda živijo nezemljani oziroma druga živa bitja. Če pa se bo to slučajno zgodilo, se verjetno še dolgo ne bo. Zvezde so tako razpršene, da so od svoje prve ""sosede"" oddaljene trilijone milj. Morda bodo nekoč vaši pravnuki stali na vrhu tujega sveta in se spraševali o svojih starodavnih prednikih?"
mt: "Many people dream of the day when people will be able to travel to another star and explore other worlds, some wonder what is out there, some believe that on another planet there may be aliens or other living beings. If this happens, it will probably not happen for a long time. Stars are so scattered that they are trillions of miles away from their first ""neighbors"". Maybe one day your descendants will stand on top of a foreign planet and wonder about their ancient ancestors?"
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: "Sonce nima skorje, kot jo ima Zemlja, na kateri se lahko stoji. Celotno Sonce je sestavljeno iz plinov, ognja in plazme. Z oddaljevanjem od središča Sonca postaja plin vse redkejši. Zunanji del, ki ga vidimo, ko gledamo Sonce, se imenuje fotosfera, kar pomeni ""krogla svetlobe""."
mt: ""The Sun has no crust, like the Earth, on which one can stand. The entire Sun is composed of gases, fire and plasma. The further away from the Sun's center, the gases become rarer. The outer part, which we see when we look at the Sun, is called the photosphere, which means ""sphere of light."""
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Okoli tri tisoč let kasneje, leta 1610, je italijanski astronom Galileo Galilei s pomočjo teleskopa ugotovil, da ima mene tudi Venera, ravno tako kot jih ima Luna. Mene nastanejo, ker je osvetljena samo tista stran Venere (ali Lune), ki je obrnjena proti Soncu. Venerine mene so podkrepile Kopernikovo teorijo, da planeti krožijo okoli sonca. Nekaj let pozneje, leta 1639, pa je angleški astronom po imenu Jeremiah Horrocks opazoval prehod Venere.
mt: 3,000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to discover that Venus also has phases, just like the Moon. Phases are created because only the side of Venus (or the Moon) facing the Sun is illuminated. Venus's phases supported Copernicus's theory that planets orbit the Sun. A few years later, in 1639, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks observed the transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Reka Amazonka je druga najdaljša in hkrati največja reka na Zemlji. Vsebuje več kot 8-krat toliko vode kot druga največja reka. Amazonka, katere predeli so široki do šest milj, je tudi najširša reka na Zemlji. Kar 20 odstotkov vode, ki se iz rek planeta izliva v oceane, prihaja iz Amazonke. Glavna reka Amazonka je dolga 6387 km (3980 milj). Vanjo se izliva na tisoče manjših rek.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest and largest river in the world. It contains more than 8 times as much water as the other largest river. The Amazon, whose parts are wide up to six miles, is also the widest river in the world. About 20 percent of the water that flows out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6387 km (3980 miles) long. Thousands of smaller rivers flow into it.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Osemnajst odstotkov Venezuelcev je brezposelnih, večina zaposlenih pa dela v sivi ekonomiji. Dve tretjini zaposlenih Venezuelcev dela v storitvenem sektorju, skoraj četrtina jih dela v industriji in petina v kmetijstvu. Pomembna industrijska panoga za Venezuelo je nafta, pri čemer je država neto izvoznica, čeprav je v naftni industriji zaposlen samo en odstotek.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed, most of the employed work in the black market economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans work in the service sector, almost a quarter work in industry and a tenth in agriculture. Venezuela's main industrial sector is oil, making it a net exporter, although only 1% of Venezuelans work in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Zvezde oddajajo svetlobo in toploto zaradi energije, ki se ustvari ob združitvi (ali zlitju) vodikovih atomov, pri čemer nastajajo težji elementi. Znanstveniki se ukvarjajo z ustvarjanjem reaktorja, ki lahko na isti način tvori energijo. To pa je zelo težka naloga in trajalo bo še kar nekaj let, preden bo zgrajen uporaben fuzijski reaktor.
mt: Stars emit light and heat because of the energy created when hydrogen atoms fuse together, creating heavier elements. Scientists are working on creating a reactor that can do the same thing. This is a very difficult task and it will be a few more years before a usable fusion reactor is built.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Elementi in spojine lahko prehajajo iz enega stanja v drugega, pri čemer se ne spremenijo. Dušik ima v plinskem stanju še vedno enake lastnosti kot tekoči dušik. V tekočem stanju je sicer gostejši, vendar so molekule enake. Voda je drug primer. Spojina vode je iz dveh atomov vodika in enega atoma kisika. Vedno ima enako molekulsko sestavo, ne glede na to, ali je v plinastem, tekočem ali trdnem stanju. Čeprav se njeno agregatno stanje lahko spremeni, njena kemijska oblika ostane ista.
mt: Elements and compounds can change from one state to another without changing. Nitrogen still has the same properties in gaseous state as liquid nitrogen. It is denser in liquid state, but the molecules are the same. Water is another example. The compound of water is two atoms of hydrogen and one atom of oxygen. It always has the same molecular composition, regardless of whether it is in gaseous, liquid or solid state. Although its aggregate state can change, its chemical form remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Med revolucionarno vojno je trinajst držav z določbami o konfederaciji najprej oblikovalo šibko osrednjo vlado – sestavljal jo je samo kongres. Kongres ni imel moči, da bi uveljavil dajatve, ker pa ni bilo narodne izvršne ali sodne oblasti, se je za izvrševanje svojih zakonov zanašal na državne oblasti, ki pogosto niso hotele sodelovati. Poleg tega ni imel nikakršnih pooblastil za razveljavitev davčnih zakonov in tarif med državami. Za dopolnjevanje členov je bilo zahtevano soglasje vseh zveznih držav, vendar posamezne zvezne države niso resno jemale osrednje oblasti, zato so bili njihovi predstavniki pogosto odsotni.
mt: 13 states with provisions for a confederation first formed a weak central government – the Congress. The Congress had no power to enforce its laws, as there was no national executive or judicial authority, and it relied on state governments to enforce its laws, which often did not want to cooperate. In addition, it had no authority to repeal tax laws and tariffs between states. To complete the articles, the consent of all the states was required, but individual states did not take the central government seriously, so their representatives were often absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: "Če ste si ogledali film Zaklad pozabljenih, morda mislite, da je na hrbtni strani Deklaracije o neodvisnosti narisan zemljevid zaklada. To pa ne drži. Kljub temu da je na hrbtni strani dokumenta nekaj napisano, ne gre za zemljevid zaklada. Na hrbtni strani Deklaracije o neodvisnosti so bile zapisane besede ""Izvirna Deklaracija o neodvisnosti z dne 4. julija 1776"". Besedilo je zapisano na dnu dokumenta, obrnjeno na glavo. Nihče ne ve zagotovo, kdo ga je napisal, vemo pa, da je bil veliki dokument na pergamentu (meri 29 3/4 palca krat 24 1/2 palca) na začetku svoje življenjske dobe shranjen v obliki zvitka. Zato je možno, da je bil zaznamek preprosto dodan kot oznaka."
mt: "If you've seen the movie National Treasure, you might think that the map to the treasure is drawn on the back of the Declaration of Independence. This is not true. Although there is some writing on the back of the document, it is not a map. On the back of the Declaration of Independence are the words "Original Declaration of Independence July 4, 1776." The writing is on the bottom of the document, upside down. No one knows for sure who wrote it, but we know that the great document on parchment (29 3/4 inches by 24 1/2 inches) was folded up at the beginning of its life. So it is possible that the doodle was simply added as a mark."
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Na začetku narodove neodvisnosti je strokovno znanje singapurskih botaničnih vrtov prispevalo k preobrazbi otoka v tropsko Mesto vrtov. Leta 1981 je bil hibrid orhideje Vanda Miss Joaquim izbran za narodno rožo.
mt: At the start of the nation's independence, the expertise of Singapore's botanic gardens contributed to the transformation of the island into a tropical City in the Gardens. In 1981, the hybrid orchid Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Na začetku narodove neodvisnosti je strokovno znanje singapurskih botaničnih vrtov prispevalo k preobrazbi otoka v tropsko Mesto vrtov. Leta 1981 je bil hibrid orhideje Vanda Miss Joaquim izbran za narodno rožo.
mt: At the start of the nation's independence, the expertise of Singapore's botanic gardens contributed to the transformation of the island into a tropical City in the Gardens. In 1981, the hybrid orchid Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Čeprav se je gradnja piramid s kamni nadaljevala do konca starega kraljestva, velikost piramid v Gizi in tehnična strokovnost njihove gradnje nikoli nista bili preseženi. V obdobju Novega kraljestva so Egipčani občudovali spomenike svojih prednikov, ki so bili takrat stari že več kot tisoč let.
mt: Although the construction of pyramids with stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the size of the pyramids at Giza and the technical expertise of their construction were never surpassed. In the New Kingdom, the Egyptians revered the monuments of their ancestors, which were then over a thousand years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Nekje okoli oktobra vsako leto se skoraj 1,5 milijona rastlinojedcev iz hribovja na severu odpravi proti južnim planjavam in pri tem prečkajo reko Mara, da bi ujeli deževje. Nato pa po deževju okoli aprila nazaj na sever prek zahoda, kjer ponovno prečkajo reko Maro. Območje Serengeti pokriva narodni park Serengeti, zaščiteno območje Ngorongoro in živalski rezervat Maswa v Tanzaniji ter narodni rezervat Maasai Mara v Keniji.
mt: 1.5 million herbivores leave the northern hills every October to head to the southern plains, crossing the Mara River in the process. After the rains in April, they return to the north via the west, crossing the Mara River again. The Serengeti area includes the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, the Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: Ko se je bitka za Francijo končala, se je Nemčija začela pripravljati na invazijo na Britanijo. Nemčija je napad poimenovala s kodnim imenom »operacija Morski lev«. Britanska vojska je med evakuacijo iz Dunkirka izgubila večino težke artilerije in zalog, zato je bila precej oslabljena. Vendar je bila kraljeva mornarica vseeno veliko močnejša od nemške (»Kriegsmarine«) in bi lahko uničila katero koli invazijsko floto, ki bi plula skozi Rokavski preliv. Le malo ladij Kraljeve mornarice pa je bilo zasidrano blizu predvidenih poti napada, saj so se admirali bali, da bi potonili zaradi nemških zračnih napadov.
mt: When the Battle for France ended, Germany began preparing for an invasion of Britain. Germany called the attack "Operation Sea Lion". The British Army lost most of its heavy artillery and supplies during the evacuation from Dunkirk, so it was considerably weakened. However, the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy ("Kriegsmarine") and could have easily destroyed any invasion fleet that would have sailed through the English Channel. Only a few ships of the Royal Navy were stationed near the expected invasion routes, as admirals feared that they would be sunk by German air attacks.
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: "Naj za začetek pojasnimo, kakšne načrte je imela Italija. Italija je bila predvsem ""mlajša sestra"" Nemčije in Japonske. Imela je šibkejšo vojsko in mornarico, čeprav so zgradili štiri nove ladje ravno pred začetkom vojne. Glavni cilj Italije so bile afriške države. Za osvojitev teh držav bi morali imeti vojaška izstrelišča, da bi lahko vojaki prepotovali sredozemsko morje in napadli Afriko. Torej so se morali znebiti britanskih oporišč in ladij v Egiptu. Razen teh ukrepov, italijanske bojne ladje niso bile predvidene za nič drugega. Zdaj je na vrsti Japonska. Japonska je bila otoška država, tako kot Britanija."
mt: "Let's start by explaining Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the "younger sister" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and navy, although they built four new ships just before the start of the war. Italy's main goal was to conquer African countries. To do this, they needed military bases, so their soldiers could travel across the Mediterranean Sea and attack Africa. Therefore, they needed to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Other than these steps, Italian battleships were not expected to do anything else. Now it's Japan's turn. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: "Z izkrcanji na dan D in bitkami, ki so temu sledile, so osvobodili severno Francijo, južna pa je bila še vedno neosvobojena. Vladali so mu ""višijski"" Francozi. To so bili Francozi, ki so leta 1940 sklenili mir z Nemci in so z osvajalci sodelovali, namesto da bi se borili proti njim. 15. avgusta 1940 so zavezniške sile zasedle južno Francijo, invazija se je imenovala ""operacija Dragoon"". Američani in Francoske svobodne sile so v samo dveh tednih osvobodili jug Francije in se usmerili proti Nemčiji."
mt: "With the landings on D-Day and the battles that followed, they liberated northern France, but the south was still not liberated. It was ruled by the "Vichy" French. These were the French who in 1940 made peace with the Germans and collaborated with the invaders, instead of fighting against them. On August 15, 1940, Allied forces occupied southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon". Americans and French Free Forces liberated the south of France in just two weeks and turned towards Germany."
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: Podmornice so ladje za podvodno plutje, ki ostanejo pod vodo dlje časa. Podmornice so uporabljali v 1. in 2. svetovni vojni. V tistih časih so bile še zelo počasne in so imele zelo omejen domet streljanja. Na začetku vojne so večinoma plule po gladini morja, z razvojem in vedno večjo natančnostjo radarjev pa so se bile podmornice prisiljene potopiti pod vodo, da jih niso opazili. Nemške podmornice so se imenovale U-podmornice. Nemci so bili dobri navigatorji in upravljavci podmornic. Ker so bili s podmornicami tako uspešni, jih Nemci po vojni niso smeli veliko obdržati.
mt: Submarines are ships that stay underwater for long periods of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. In those days they were very slow and had very limited range of fire. At the beginning of the war they mostly cruised on the surface of the sea, but as radar technology improved and became more accurate, submarines were forced to submerge to avoid detection. German submarines were called U-boats. The Germans were good navigators and submarine operators. Because they were so successful with submarines, the Germans were not allowed to keep many after the war.
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.
